Blog Posts.title: Google’s decision to deprecate JPEG-XL emphasizes the need for browser choice and free formats
Blog Posts.Author: Cloudinary Team
Blog Posts.Summary: Google's decision to deprecate JPEG XL in Chrome highlights the importance of browser diversity and the need for free and open image formats, like JPEG XL, to ensure that users are not locked into proprietary technologies.

In the News.Title: Mozilla Is Interested In A Rust JPEG-XL Decoder For Firefox & Google Might Develop It
In the News.Author: Michael Larabel
In the News.Summary: Mozilla is exploring the adoption of a Rust-based JPEG-XL decoder, contingent on assurances of security, performance, and compatibility.

In the News.Title: Green coding – Cloudinary: Could a JPEG successor render greener?
In the News.Author: Adrian Bridgwater
In the News.Summary: Cloudinary’s JPEG XL optimizes compression and efficiency, reducing storage costs, lowers bandwidth consumption, decreasing carbon emissions at a massive scale.

In the News.Title: Google’s Jpegli open-source library can compress high quality images 35% more than traditional JPEG codecs
In the News.Author: Jean-Luc Aufranc
In the News.Summary: Google’s Jpegli open-source library offers a next-gen Image Compression codec that can compress images up to 35% more than traditional JPEG while maintaining the same quality.

In the News.Title: Linux Mint 22 Will Use The PipeWire Sound Server, Support JPEG XL Images
In the News.Author: Michael Larabel
In the News.Summary: JPEG XL support comes to Linux Mint

In the News.Title: Google is once again accused of snubbing the JPEG XL image format
In the News.Author: Alfonso Maruccia
In the News.Summary: Google is facing criticism for allegedly ignoring the JPEG XL image format, a more efficient and higher-quality alternative to traditional JPEG, in its Chrome browser and Android operating system.

In the News.Title: Still no love for JPEG XL: Browser maker love-in snubs next-gen image format
In the News.Author: Thomas Claburn
In the News.Summary: The JPEG XL image format, designed to replace traditional JPEG, has reached a major milestone with the announcement of interoperability between different implementations, paving the way for wider adoption in 2024.

In the News.Title: The new Pixelmator Pro update enables a full HDR image editing workflow
In the News.Author: Benjamin Mayo
In the News.Summary: Full HDR workflow comes to Pixelmator Pro with support for JPEG XL

In the News.Title: Google snubbed JPEG XL so of course Apple now supports it in Safari
In the News.Author: Thomas Claburn
In the News.Summary: Apple’s Safari browser now supports JPEG XL, a next-generation image format that offers better compression and quality than traditional JPEG, marking a significant milestone in the format’s adoption.
